subject: Leadership
title: Self-Awareness in Leadership
description: A micro-lesson that makes Self-Awareness in Leadership usable.

hook.text: 95% of people think they're self-aware. Research says only 10-15% actually are. Leaders are no exception.

buildup.text: Self-awareness means understanding your strengths, weaknesses, emotions, and how others experience you.

discovery.text: Tasha Eurich found two types: internal (how you see yourself) and external (how others see you). Both matter.

twist.text: More experience doesn't mean more self-awareness. Senior leaders are often the least self-aware in the room.

climax.text: Self-aware leaders make better decisions, build stronger teams, and advance faster. It's the meta-skill of leadership.

punchline.text: You can't lead others until you understand yourself.

quiz.question: What percentage of people are truly self-aware according to research?
